Grouped_Utterances: It felt good, actually. I was nervous going in, but once I did it, I felt a bit of relief. Well, I did have a couple of moments where I felt really down again, especially when I was alone at home. I think it’s just the loneliness creeping back in. Sometimes I just feel like I’m stuck in a rut. I think I’m just worried about not fitting in or being awkward again.
I did, and it helped a bit. I still wake up sometimes, but I feel more relaxed going to bed.

Hi, Ellie! I actually did try talking to a cashier. It was a little awkward, but I did it! I’ve thought about joining a club or something. But I still feel hesitant. I think I want someone who is understanding and shares similar interests.  I guess through hobbies or activities I enjoy. That’s why joining a club seems like a good idea.

Those feelings are very common. Remember, everyone else is there to connect as well. What if you tried attending a meeting or event just to observe first? How about trying a sleep journal? You can jot down your thoughts before bed to clear your mind.

Great! Let’s aim for that this week. You don’t have to commit to anything, just see how it feels.  You’re welcome! I’m proud of the steps you’re taking. Let’s check in next week on how everything goes.
